title: Indian PM Modi calls deadly Delhi blast ‘conspiracy’
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday (Nov 11) called a deadly car explosion in the heart of the capital a “conspiracy”, vowing those responsible will face justice.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m, today (12), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Six arrested with 300kg of narcotics in Kirinda
byline: Six individuals have been arrested with 300 kilograms of narcotic substances in Kirinda by the Western Province North Crimes Range and a team from the Southern Province Police, police said.

title: No threat to Sri Lanka from blasts in India and Pakistan – Minister Wijepala
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala claims that there is no security threat to Sri Lanka from the recent explosions that occurred in India and Pakistan.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga arrested
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga arrives at Bribery Comission
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia sign MoU to form joint business council
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath announced the establishment of the historic Sri Lanka–Saudi Arabia Joint Business Council, marking a significant milestone in strengthening economic relations between the two nations.

title: SJB’s Sameera Dhanushka appointed to Weligama PS following chairman’s death
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued announcing the appointment of Sameera Dhanushka De Silva of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) as a member of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, representing Ward No. 07, Midigama West.

title: Apple is selling a $230 iPhone pocket inspired by a ‘piece of cloth’
byline: The tech giant is getting in on the trend of people wearing their phones and tapping a luxury fashion brand for its latest collaboration. Apple plans to release this week a special-edition iPhone pocket designed in collaboration with the high-end Japanese brand Issey Miyake.

title: Squid Game star, 81, acquitted of sexual misconduct
byline: Squid Game star O Yeong-Su has been acquitted of sexual misconduct charges by a court in South Korea.

title: Protesters force their way into COP30 summit venue, clash with security
byline: Dozens of Indigenous protesters forced their way into the COP30 climate summit venue on Tuesday and clashed with security guards at the entrance to demand climate action and forest protection.

title: Sri Lanka and Latvia sign agreement on transfer of sentenced persons
byline: In a move to strengthen bilateral cooperation in consular and legal affairs, Sri Lanka and Latvia have signed the Agreement on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons at the High Commission of Sri Lanka in New Delhi.

title: US has to bring in talent from around the world: President Trump on H-1B visa
byline: US President Donald Trump appeared to defend the H-1B visa programme, saying America has to bring in talent from around the world as it does not have “certain talents” in the country.

title: ‘Dambulla Thunders’ owner indicted over alleged LPL match-fixing
byline: The owner of the “Dambulla Thunders” franchise, Tamim Rahman was served indictment today (12) before the Colombo High Court for allegedly influencing a cricketer who participated in last year’s Lanka Premier League (LPL) cricket tournament to engage in match-fixing.

title: Insurance scheme for seed paddy production farms
byline: An insurance scheme has been planned to provide coverage for paddy cultivation in seed paddy production farms, the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board announced.

title: Two suspects including Aava Gang’s leader ‘Vinod’ arrested
byline: Two suspects including ‘Vinod,’ believed to be the leader of the notorious criminal gang operating in the Northern Province, known as ‘Aava Gang’, have been arrested by Chunnakam Police.

title: Thalawa bus accident caused by driver’s negligence, police tell court
byline: The driver of the bus who was arrested and produced before the court over the bus accident that took place near the Jaya Ganga area in Thalawa, which claimed the life of a school student and caused serious and minor injuries to nearly 40 other passengers, has been remanded until November 18 by the Thambuththegama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Former NPP Peliyagoda councillor’s husband remanded
byline: The former National People’s Power (NPP) Peliyagoda Urban Councillor’s husband, who was arrested in Anuradhapura with heroin and subsequently suspended from his position as a school principal in Eppawala, has been remanded until November 26 by the Thambuththegama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ex-Minister Prasanna Ranatunga produced before court
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (12).

title: Endangered leopard killed by poachers in Wellawaya
byline: A leopard belonging to a rare and endangered species has been shot and killed in Migaha Ara within the Buduruwagala Reservoir.

title: PayPal re-launches in the UK after nearly two years
byline: PayPal said on Wednesday it is re-launching in the United Kingdom for customers to shop online and in stores, nearly two years after it restructured its operations there following Brexit.

title: CCB to destroy 5,000 coconut trees in Matara due to wilt disease
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board (CCB) has decided to cut down and destroy about 5,000 coconut trees in the Matara District, due to the rapid spread of the coconut root (wilt) disease.

title: Customs surpasses 2025 revenue target of Rs. 2,115 billion
byline: Sri Lanka Customs has announced that it has surpassed the revenue target of Rs. 2,115 billion set for the year 2025, yesterday (11).

title: Police confirm 345kg of ‘Ice’ seized in Kirinda drug bust
byline: Police have confirmed that a total of 345 kilograms of the narcotic substance “Ice” (crystal methamphetamine) were recovered following the arrest of eight suspects during a special operation conducted in Kirinda this morning (12).

title: Turkey confirms 20 troops killed in Georgia plane crash; inspections ongoing
byline: Turkey on Wednesday said 20 of its soldiers were killed when a military transport plane crashed in Georgia a day earlier, marking the NATO member’s deadliest military incident since 2020.

title: Ex-Minister Prasanna Ranatunga granted bail
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), earlier today (12) on allegations of misappropriating public funds, has been granted bail.

title: More details revealed on Kirinda drug haul seizure; 8 suspects, 6 vehicles in custody
byline: The Police Western Province North Crimes Division arrested eight suspects along with over 300 kilograms of narcotic substances that were being transported by land earlier this morning (12), following a special operation carried out on the Andagalawella Beach in Kirinda.

title: Two injured in bus, three-wheeler collision in Gelioya
byline: Two individuals sustained injuries when a bus and a three-wheeler collided in Gelioya, police stated.

title: Earthquake rattles Cyprus, no immediate reports of damage
byline: An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.2 rattled parts of Cyprus on Wednesday, but there were no immediate reports of damage.

title: Pokemon theme park PokePark Kanto to open in Japan in February 2026
byline: Pokemon lovers, here’s some good news. The first-ever permanent outdoor Pokemon theme park, PokePark Kanto, will officially open its doors on Feb 5, 2026.

title: Chinese ‘cryptoqueen’ jailed in UK over $6.6 billion Bitcoin scam
byline: A Chinese woman who was found with 5 billion pounds ($6.6 billion) in Bitcoin after defrauding more than 128,000 people in China in a Ponzi scheme was sentenced by a UK court on Tuesday to over 11 years in prison.

title: Sri Lanka to accelerate Unique Digital Identity project
byline: Attention has been drawn towards expediting the Sri Lanka Unique Digital Identity project during a progress review meeting of the Ministry of Digital Economy for the year 2025.

title: Schools go hybrid as Delhi’s air quality worsens
byline: Schools in Delhi have been asked to run hybrid classes for primary students and non-essential construction activity has been banned as air quality worsens in the Indian capital.

title: 16 Sri Lankan players touring Pakistan decide to return home following yesterday’s suicide bomb blast
byline: Sixteen Sri Lankan players touring Pakistan have decided to return home following a suicide bomb blast in Islamabad.

title: Discussion held to accelerate efforts to resolve land-related issues in Jaffna
byline: A high-level meeting has been held at the Parliament Complex to evaluate the progress of releasing privately owned lands in the Jaffna and Palali areas currently under military use.

title: Over 15 injured in bus–tipper collision in Ambalantota
byline: At least 15 people sustained injuries following a head-on collision between a bus and a tipper truck occurred this afternoon (12) in Kiula, Ambalantota.

title: Taliban sets three-month deadline for traders to end reliance on Pakistan routes
byline: Deputy Prime Minister for Economic Affairs of Afghanistan, Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar has told traders to reduce business with Pakistan and use other routes for the transit of goods.

title: Woman dead, two others injured in Gelioya accident
byline: A woman has died while two others have sustained injuries in an accident reported in Karamada, Gelioya this afternoon (12).

title: Man remanded for impersonating veteran film director and demanding sexual bribes from actresses
byline: A man who allegedly demanded sexual bribes from women by misusing the name of veteran film director Sanath Abeysekara has been remanded in custody.

title: Dambulla PS heats up over big onion prices
byline: The opposition members of the Dambulla Pradeshiya Sabha attended today’s (12) council meeting wearing garlands made of locally produced big onions.

title: Sabrina Carpenter to lead ‘Alice in Wonderland’-inspired musical at Universal
byline: Sabrina Carpenter is headed to the movies. The pop star will lead her first major studio feature with a new musical at Universal Pictures.

title: 35th IMBL meeting concludes on successful note
byline: The 35th International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL) meeting between the Sri Lanka and Indian Navies and Coast Guards was held on board INS Sukanya, at the Indo-Sri Lanka Maritime Boundary Line, north of Kankesanthurai.

title: EU looks to Big Tech, influencers to fight hybrid threats, fake news
byline: Europe is looking to online platforms and influencers to help fight disinformation and promote democracy according to a European Commission strategy presented on Wednesday amid concerns over interference by foreign governments in national elections.

title: India says Delhi car blast was a ‘terrorist incident’
byline: India has classified a deadly car blast that killed 12 people and wounded at least 20 in the capital Delhi on Monday (Nov 10) as a “terrorist incident”, according to a resolution passed by the country’s federal Cabinet of ministers.

title: 16 Sri Lankan players in Pakistan decide to return home following yesterday’s suicide bomb blast
byline: Sixteen Sri Lankan players touring Pakistan have decided to return home following a suicide bomb blast in Islamabad.

title: Galle Prison relocation plan mooted
byline: The proposal to relocate the Galle Prison from its current location has been discussed at the Galle District Coordinating Committee meeting.
